column5: I was never the smartest from the begining, so not sure if my IQ really was that great before I started drinking.
In defense of drinking, when I was younger I did some really dumb stuff when I was sober.
In defense of drinking, when I was younger I did some really dumb stuff when I was sober. Kinda makes you wonder if you did stupider things when you were hammered but didn't realise it.
At least we didnt have smart phones to videotape???
No kidding whoever OKed that study must have been drinking.
DAMN... I don't want to remember half of what I knew anyhow.
I read alot of pubmed. You would be in shock if you seen how many useless studies are done, and on some occasions hundreds of times lol.
OK, this explains a lot........all politicians must be drunks...

I have found after 15 plus years here that alcohol most certainly does make people do/say less than intelligent things. I could have saved them scientist a lot of money if they would have only asked.  Art
I read somewhere that drinking kills weak brain cells, leaving you with a noggin packed with strong brain cells.  That's the theory I'm going with.

I read somewhere that drinking kills weak brain cells, leaving you with a noggin packed with strong brain cells.  That's the theory I'm going with.  sorry for the voice over, couldn't find the version with Cliff saying it  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HMV_fJDruog

I read somewhere that drinking kills weak brain cells, leaving you with a noggin packed with strong brain cells.  That's the theory I'm going with. BRILLIANT ! ! !  Bartender.........give everyone a round on Sterling...........that man is BRILLIANT ! ! !
Boss, you posted on a non fishing thread. Giving in?
That makes me dumber than a day old capybara..........
A young man is a fool to drink. An old man is a fool not to drink.
If that was true wouldn't be able to tie my shoes up thank god for velcro
